Class InputValidation

java.lang.Object
InputValidation
public class InputValidation extends Object
Class that handles the validation of the inputs. The amount field should be a number between 0 and 1000, and the category field should either be "food", "travel", "bills", "entertainment", or "other".

  • Method Details

    • amountValidation

      public static double amountValidation(String amount_str) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the amount field. This number should be between 0 and 1000.
      Parameters:
      amount_str - The user's input of the amount.
      Returns:
      The amount if it is valid.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the amount is less than or equal to 0, greater than or equal to 1000, or not a number.

    • categoryValidation

      public static String categoryValidation(String category_str) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the category field. This value should be "food", "travel", "bills", "entertainment", or "other".
      Parameters:
      category_str - The user's input of the category.
      Returns:
      The category if it is valid.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the category is not one of the categories specified in the valid category list.
